episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of topics including the invention of the personal cassette player, the decision-making processes of baboons, the pitch-perfect voice of Ella Fitzgerald, and the rivalry between Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sylvester Stallone that led to the making of the film "Stop! Or My Mom Will Shoot."

facts.fact: The prototype personal cassette player was a block of wood which the inventor carried around in his pocket to make sure it would fit.
Baboons can take 45 minutes debating which direction to go in the morning.
Ella Fitzgerald's voice was so pitch-perfect that musicians would tune their instruments to it.
As part of their rivalry, Arnold Schwarzenegger tricked Sylvester Stallone into making "Stop! Or My Mom Will Shoot."
